_**Avengers: Infinity War**_ is a 2018 American [superhero film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superhero_film "Superhero film") based on the [Marvel Comics](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Comics "Marvel Comics") superhero team the [Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_(comics) "Avengers (comics)"). Produced by [Marvel Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Studios "Marvel Studios") and distributed by [Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walt_Disney_Studios_Motion_Pictures "Walt Disney Studios Motion Pictures"), it is the sequel to _[The Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Avengers\_(2012\_film) "The Avengers (2012 film)")_ (2012) and _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Age\_of\_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ (2015), and [the 19th film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_films "List of Marvel Cinematic Universe films") in the [Marvel Cinematic Universe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe "Marvel Cinematic Universe") (MCU). Directed by [Anthony and Joe Russo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_and_Joe_Russo "Anthony and Joe Russo") and written by [Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Markus_and_Stephen_McFeely "Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely"), the film features an [ensemble cast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ensemble_cast "Ensemble cast") including [Robert Downey Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Downey_Jr. "Robert Downey Jr."), [Chris Hemsworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth "Chris Hemsworth"), [Mark Ruffalo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Ruffalo "Mark Ruffalo"), [Chris Evans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Evans_(actor) "Chris Evans (actor)"), [Scarlett Johansson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarlett_Johansson "Scarlett Johansson"), [Benedict Cumberbatch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benedict_Cumberbatch "Benedict Cumberbatch"), [Don Cheadle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Cheadle "Don Cheadle"), [Tom Holland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Holland "Tom Holland"), [Chadwick Boseman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman "Chadwick Boseman"), [Paul Bettany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Bettany "Paul Bettany"), [Elizabeth Olsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Olsen "Elizabeth Olsen"), [Anthony Mackie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_Mackie "Anthony Mackie"), [Sebastian Stan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Stan "Sebastian Stan"), [Danai Gurira](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danai_Gurira "Danai Gurira"), [Letitia Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letitia_Wright "Letitia Wright"), [Dave Bautista](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Bautista "Dave Bautista"), [Zoe Saldaña](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoe_Salda%C3%B1a "Zoe Saldaña"), [Josh Brolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josh_Brolin "Josh Brolin"), and [Chris Pratt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Pratt "Chris Pratt"). In the film, the [Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Avengers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and the [Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Guardians of the Galaxy (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") attempt to stop [Thanos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanos_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thanos (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from collecting the six powerful [Infinity Stones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity_Stones "Infinity Stones") as part of his quest to kill half of all life in the universe.

The film was announced in October 2014 as _Avengers: Infinity War – Part 1_. The Russo brothers came on board to direct in April 2015, and a month later, Markus and McFeely signed on to write the script for the film, which draws inspiration from [Jim Starlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Starlin "Jim Starlin")'s 1991 comic book _[The Infinity Gauntlet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Infinity\_Gauntlet "The Infinity Gauntlet")_ and [Jonathan Hickman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Hickman "Jonathan Hickman")'s 2013 comic book _[Infinity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity\_(comic\_book) "Infinity (comic book)")_. In 2016, Marvel shortened the title to _Avengers: Infinity War_. Filming began in January 2017 at [Pinewood Atlanta Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinewood_Atlanta_Studios "Pinewood Atlanta Studios") in [Fayette County, Georgia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fayette_County,_Georgia "Fayette County, Georgia"), with a large cast consisting mostly of actors reprising their roles from [previous MCU films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_film_actors_(The_Infinity_Saga) "List of Marvel Cinematic Universe film actors (The Infinity Saga)"), including Brolin as Thanos. The production lasted until July 2017, shooting [back-to-back](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Back-to-back_film_production "Back-to-back film production") with a direct sequel, _[Avengers: Endgame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Endgame "Avengers: Endgame")_ (2019). Additional filming took place in Scotland, the [Downtown Atlanta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downtown_Atlanta "Downtown Atlanta") area, and New York City. With an estimated budget of $325–400 million, the film is one of the [most expensive films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_films "List of most expensive films") ever made.

_Avengers: Infinity War_ premiered at the [Dolby Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolby_Theatre "Dolby Theatre") in [Hollywood, Los Angeles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood,_Los_Angeles "Hollywood, Los Angeles"), on April 23, 2018, and was released in the United States on April 27 as part of [Phase Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Three "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Three") of the MCU. The film received positive reviews from critics, with praise for Brolin's performance and the Russo brothers' direction, as well as the visual effects, action sequences, dark tone, and musical score. It was a major box-office success, becoming the fourth film and the [first superhero film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_superhero_films#Top_50_superhero_movies_at_the_worldwide_box_office "List of highest-grossing superhero films") to gross over $2 billion worldwide, breaking numerous [box office records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_box_office_records_set_by_Avengers:_Infinity_War "List of box office records set by Avengers: Infinity War"), and becoming the [highest-grossing film of 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_in_film#Highest-grossing_films "2018 in film") and the [fourth-highest-grossing film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films "List of highest-grossing films") at the time of its release both worldwide and [in the United States and Canada](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films_in_the_United_States_and_Canada "List of highest-grossing films in the United States and Canada"). It received a nomination for [Best Visual Effects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Visual_Effects "Academy Award for Best Visual Effects") at the [91st Academy Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/91st_Academy_Awards "91st Academy Awards"), among [numerous other accolades](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_accolades_received_by_Avengers:_Infinity_War "List of accolades received by Avengers: Infinity War"). The sequel, _Avengers: Endgame_, was released in April 2019.

Plot
----

Having acquired the Power Stone—one of six [Infinity Stones](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity_Stones "Infinity Stones")—from the planet [Xandar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Xandar_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Xandar (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Thanos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanos_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thanos (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and his lieutenants—[Ebony Maw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ebony_Maw_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ebony Maw (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Cull Obsidian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cull_Obsidian "Cull Obsidian"), [Proxima Midnight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxima_Midnight_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Proxima Midnight (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and [Corvus Glaive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corvus_Glaive_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Corvus Glaive (Marvel Cinematic Universe)")—intercept [the spaceship](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Statesman_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Statesman (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") carrying the survivors of [Asgard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asgard_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Asgard (Marvel Cinematic Universe)")'s destruction.[[a]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-5) After subduing [Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thor (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), Thanos extracts the Space Stone from the [Tesseract](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesseract_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Tesseract (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), overpowers the [Hulk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bruce Banner (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), kills [Loki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Loki (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and fatally wounds [Heimdall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heimdall_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Heimdall (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Before dying, Heimdall sends Hulk to Earth using the [Bifröst](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bifrost_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bifrost (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Thanos and his lieutenants leave, destroying the ship.

Hulk crash-lands in the [Sanctum Sanctorum](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_York_Sanctum "New York Sanctum") in New York City, reverting to the form of Bruce Banner. He warns [Stephen Strange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Strange_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Stephen Strange (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Wong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wong_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wong (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") about Thanos's plan to destroy half of all life in the universe, and they recruit [Tony Stark](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Tony Stark (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Maw and Obsidian arrive to retrieve the Time Stone from Strange, drawing [Peter Parker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Parker_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Peter Parker (Marvel Cinematic Universe)")'s attention. Maw, unable to take the Time Stone due to Strange's enchantment, captures him. Stark and Parker sneak aboard Maw's spaceship while Wong stays behind to guard the Sanctum.

The [Guardians of the Galaxy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians_of_the_Galaxy_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Guardians of the Galaxy (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") respond to the Asgardian ship's distress call and rescue Thor. Thor surmises that Thanos is after the Reality Stone, which [Taneleer Tivan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taneleer_Tivan_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Taneleer Tivan (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") possesses on [Knowhere](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Knowhere_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Knowhere (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). He travels with [Rocket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocket_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Rocket (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Groot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groot_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Groot (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") to [Nidavellir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nidavellir_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nidavellir (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") to enlist the dwarf king [Eitri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eitri_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Eitri (Marvel Cinematic Universe)")'s aid in creating the battle-axe [Stormbreaker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stormbreaker_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Stormbreaker (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). [Peter Quill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Quill_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Peter Quill (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Gamora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamora_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Gamora (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Drax](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drax_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Drax (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and [Mantis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Mantis (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") travel to Knowhere, finding Thanos already has the Reality Stone. Thanos kidnaps Gamora, who discloses the Soul Stone's location to save [Nebula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nebula_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nebula (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from torture. On [Vormir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vormir_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Vormir (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the Stone's keeper, [Red Skull](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Skull_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Red Skull (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), tells Thanos that he can only acquire it by sacrificing someone he loves. Thanos sacrifices Gamora, earning the Stone.

Midnight and Glaive ambush [Wanda Maximoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wanda Maximoff (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Vision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Vision (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in [Edinburgh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Edinburgh "Edinburgh") to retrieve the Mind Stone which is in Vision's forehead. [Steve Rogers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Steve Rogers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Natasha Romanoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natasha_Romanoff_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Natasha Romanoff (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and [Sam Wilson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Wilson_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Sam Wilson (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") rescue them and they take shelter with [James Rhodes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Rhodes_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "James Rhodes (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and Banner at the [Avengers Compound](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_Compound_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Avengers Compound (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Vision asks Wanda to destroy him and the Mind Stone to keep it from Thanos, but she refuses. The group travels to [Wakanda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wakanda_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wakanda (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), which Rogers believes has the resources to remove the Stone without killing Vision.

Nebula escapes captivity and asks the remaining Guardians to meet her on Thanos's destroyed homeworld, [Titan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titan_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Titan (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Stark and Parker kill Maw and rescue Strange. The trio crash-lands on Titan, where they meet Quill, Drax, and Mantis. Using the Time Stone, Strange views millions of possible futures, seeing only one in which the [Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Avengers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") win. The group formulates a plan to subdue Thanos and remove the Infinity Gauntlet, with which he safely houses and wields the Stones. Thanos appears, justifying his plans as necessary to guarantee the survival of an overpopulated universe. Nebula arrives soon after and helps the others subdue Thanos, but deduces that Thanos has killed Gamora. Enraged, Quill attacks Thanos, allowing him to break the group's hold and overpower them. Thanos grievously wounds Stark, but Strange offers the Time Stone in exchange for sparing Stark's life.

In Wakanda, Rogers reunites with [Bucky Barnes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bucky_Barnes_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bucky Barnes (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") before Thanos' army invades. The Avengers, along with [T'Challa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%27Challa_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "T'Challa (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and the Wakandan forces, mount a defense while [Shuri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuri_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Shuri (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") works to extract the Mind Stone from Vision. Unable to summon the Hulk, Banner fights in Stark's [Hulkbuster armor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hulkbuster_armor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Hulkbuster armor (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Thor, Rocket, and Groot arrive to reinforce the Avengers. Together they kill Midnight, Obsidian, and Glaive, and rout Thanos's army. Shuri cannot complete the extraction before Thanos arrives on the field; the Avengers and their allies fail to stop him from reaching Vision. Vision convinces a reluctant Wanda to destroy him and the Mind Stone, but Thanos uses the Time Stone to reverse her actions, rip the stone from Vision's forehead, and complete the Gauntlet. Thor severely wounds Thanos with Stormbreaker, but Thanos activates the completed Gauntlet by [snapping his fingers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Blip "The Blip") before teleporting away.

Half of all life across the universe disintegrates, including Barnes, T'Challa, Groot, Wanda, Wilson, Mantis, Drax, Quill, Strange, Parker, [Maria Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Hill_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Maria Hill (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and [Nick Fury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Fury_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nick Fury (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the last of whom sends an emergency signal on a modified [pager](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pager "Pager") before disintegrating.[[b]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-7) Stark and Nebula remain stranded on Titan while Banner, [M'Baku](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%27Baku_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "M'Baku (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), [Okoye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okoye_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Okoye (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), Rhodes, Rocket, Rogers, Romanoff, and Thor are left on the Wakandan battlefield. Meanwhile, Thanos watches a sunrise on a remote planet.

Cast
----

*   [Robert Downey Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Downey_Jr. "Robert Downey Jr.") as [Tony Stark / Iron Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tony_Stark_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Tony Stark (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

The benefactor of the [Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Avengers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") who is a self-described genius, billionaire, playboy, and philanthropist with [electromechanical suits of armor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron_Man%27s_armor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Iron Man's armor (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") of his own making.[[6]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DowneyInfinity-8)[[7]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DowneyClarify-9) Co-director [Joe Russo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joe_Russo_(director) "Joe Russo (director)") explained that Stark "senses this greater threat approaching, so he is doing everything in his power to keep the Earth safe".[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Holland-10) Downey added that Stark has smaller goals than in previous films.[[9]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DowneyEW-11)
*   [Chris Hemsworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth "Chris Hemsworth") as [Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thor (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An Avenger and the king of [Asgard](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Asgard_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Asgard (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), based on the [Norse mythological](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norse_mythology "Norse mythology") deity [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor "Thor").[[10]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HemsworthEvans-12) Joe Russo stated that Thor's storyline picks up after the events of _[Thor: Ragnarok](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor:\_Ragnarok "Thor: Ragnarok")_ (2017), which finds him in a "very profound", "very interesting place" with "real emotional motivation".[[11]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RussosApr2016-13) At the recommendation of Hemsworth, writers [Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Markus_and_Stephen_McFeely "Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely") consulted _Thor: Ragnarok_ director [Taika Waititi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taika_Waititi "Taika Waititi") and screenwriter [Eric Pearson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eric_Pearson "Eric Pearson") to help carry over the comedic and tragic elements of the re-toned Thor from that film.[[12]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WritersTHR-14) Joe Russo said that Thor has "the driving hero's arc of the movie which stands in direct opposition to Thanos' argument" and would have been the main protagonist of the film had Thor killed Thanos.[[13]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WiredAug2018-15)
*   [Mark Ruffalo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Ruffalo "Mark Ruffalo") as [Bruce Banner / Hulk](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bruce_Banner_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bruce Banner (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An Avenger and genius scientist who, because of exposure to [gamma radiation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamma_radiation "Gamma radiation"), typically transforms into a monster when enraged or agitated.[[14]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Oct2014EventQA-16)[[15]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RuffaloYahooJan2016-17) Banner spends the film trying to reintegrate with the Avengers and "impress upon everybody how dangerous Thanos is".[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ColliderRuffaloBosemanMarch2018-18) Joe Russo felt the Hulk refusing to appear for much of the film was only partially because he was scared, but also because he realizes that "Banner only wants Hulk for fighting. I think he's had enough of saving Banner's ass". Russo added that this was "really reflective of the journey from _Ragnarok_ [...] [where] these two characters are constantly in conflict with each other over control".[[17]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RussoHulkScared-19) Banner's appearance in the film continues a story arc for the character that was established in _Thor: Ragnarok_ and concludes in _[Avengers: Endgame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Endgame "Avengers: Endgame")_ (2019),[[18]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RuffaloHulkArc-20) with the difference between Hulk and Banner "starting to blur a little bit". Ruffalo described Hulk in _Infinity War_ as having the mental capacity of a five-year-old.[[16]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ColliderRuffaloBosemanMarch2018-18)
*   [Chris Evans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Evans_(actor) "Chris Evans (actor)") as [Steve Rogers / Captain America](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Steve_Rogers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Steve Rogers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

The fugitive leader of the non-regulation faction of Avengers. A [World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II "World War II") veteran, he was enhanced to the peak of human physicality by an experimental serum and frozen in suspended animation before waking up in the modern world.[[10]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HemsworthEvans-12) Joe Russo said after the events of _[Captain America: Civil War](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_Civil\_War "Captain America: Civil War")_ (2016), Rogers struggles with the conflict between his responsibility to himself and his responsibility to others. The character embodies the "spirit" of the comic book identity [Nomad](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nomad_(comics) "Nomad (comics)") in the film,[[19]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NotNomad-21) and receives new vibranium gauntlets from Shuri to replace [his old shield](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_America%27s_shield_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Captain America's shield (Marvel Cinematic Universe)").[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTS-22) An early draft of the film had Rogers first appearing at the end of the film to save [Vision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Vision (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") from [Corvus Glaive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corvus_Glaive_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Corvus Glaive (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") in [Wakanda](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wakanda_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wakanda (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"). Markus and McFeely were called "insane" for waiting that long to introduce Rogers into the film and ultimately conceded it was "not [a] satisfying" approach.[[21]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RogersLateEntry-23)
*   [Scarlett Johansson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scarlett_Johansson "Scarlett Johansson") as [Natasha Romanoff / Black Widow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natasha_Romanoff_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Natasha Romanoff (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A highly trained spy, member of Rogers' faction of Avengers, and former agent of [S.H.I.E.L.D.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/S.H.I.E.L.D._(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "S.H.I.E.L.D. (Marvel Cinematic Universe)")[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Boseman-24) Johansson said that Romanoff's situation following _Captain America: Civil War_ has been "a dark time. I wouldn't say that my character has been particularly hopeful, but I think she's hardened even more than she probably was before."[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTSPg3-25)
*   [Benedict Cumberbatch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benedict_Cumberbatch "Benedict Cumberbatch") as Dr. [Stephen Strange](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_Strange_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Stephen Strange (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A former [neurosurgeon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Neurosurgeon "Neurosurgeon") who, after a car accident that led to a journey of healing, discovered the hidden world of magic and alternate dimensions and became a [Master of the Mystic Arts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Masters_of_the_Mystic_Arts_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Masters of the Mystic Arts (Marvel Cinematic Universe)").[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewPremise-26)[[25]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-StrangeHistory-27) Markus and McFeely described Strange as "[ending] up being the reasonable adult in the room" with the "widest perspective available".[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WritersEnding-28) Julian "JayFunk" Daniels once again assisted Cumberbatch with his [finger-tutting](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finger-tutting "Finger-tutting") movements.[[27]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-JayFunk-29)
*   [Don Cheadle](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Don_Cheadle "Don Cheadle") as [James "Rhodey" Rhodes / War Machine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Rhodes_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "James Rhodes (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An officer in the [U.S. Air Force](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Air_Force "U.S. Air Force") and Avenger who operates the War Machine armor.[[28]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-D232017-30) Following his paralysis during the events of _Civil War_, Rhodes is given an apparatus by Stark to walk again, although he is reluctant to don his War Machine armor and rejoin the Avengers due to his injury. Cheadle believed that Rhodes is "negotiating this reunion and his rejoining this team". He also explained that Rhodes' relationship with Stark "deepened" from his accident, saying, "I think Tony feels somewhat responsible and culpable in a way. But again, he's always had my back in a way that only he could really have".[[29]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RhodeyVisit-31)
*   [Tom Holland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Holland "Tom Holland") as [Peter Parker / Spider-Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Parker_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Peter Parker (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A teenager, Avenger and Stark's protégé who received spider-like abilities after being bitten by a radioactive spider.[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Holland-10) Downey helped coach Holland through his death scene, which was not as drawn out in the script.[[30]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HollandDeathScene-32)
*   [Chadwick Boseman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman "Chadwick Boseman") as [T'Challa / Black Panther](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/T%27Challa_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "T'Challa (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

The king of the African nation of Wakanda who gained his enhanced abilities by ingesting the Heart-Shaped Herb.[[22]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Boseman-24)[[31]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HeartShapedHerb-33) Boseman, along with the other actors from _[Black Panther](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black\_Panther\_(film) "Black Panther (film)")_ (2018) portraying Wakandans, improvised their war chants on set ahead of the battle in Wakanda. Despite both _Black Panther_ and _Infinity War_ filming at the same time, the Russos were not aware of the chants, as they had not yet seen footage from _Black Panther_, and felt the moment was "incredibly cool".[[32]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BlackPantherWakandaChants-34)
*   [Paul Bettany](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Paul_Bettany "Paul Bettany") as [Vision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vision_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Vision (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An android and Avenger created using the artificial intelligence [J.A.R.V.I.S.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/J.A.R.V.I.S. "J.A.R.V.I.S."), [Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultron_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ultron (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and the [Mind Stone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity_Stones "Infinity Stones").[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewPremise-26) Anthony Russo called Vision "a living [MacGuffin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MacGuffin "MacGuffin")"; his life being in direct conflict with Thanos' quest, which "raises the stakes".[[23]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTSPg3-25)
*   [Elizabeth Olsen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elizabeth_Olsen "Elizabeth Olsen") as [Wanda Maximoff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wanda_Maximoff_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wanda Maximoff (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): A member of Rogers' faction of Avengers who can harness magic and engage in [hypnosis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hypnosis "Hypnosis") and [telekinesis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Telekinesis "Telekinesis").[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PrattOlsen-35)
*   [Anthony Mackie](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_Mackie "Anthony Mackie") as [Sam Wilson / Falcon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sam_Wilson_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Sam Wilson (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): A member of Rogers' faction of Avengers and former [pararescueman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_States_Air_Force_Pararescue "United States Air Force Pararescue") trained by the military in aerial combat using a specially designed wing pack.[[34]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MackieConfirm-36)
*   [Sebastian Stan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sebastian_Stan "Sebastian Stan") as [Bucky Barnes / Winter Soldier](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bucky_Barnes_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Bucky Barnes (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An enhanced soldier and Rogers' ally and best friend who reemerged as a brainwashed assassin after being thought to have been [killed in action](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Killed_in_action "Killed in action") during World War II.[[35]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Stan-37) Barnes, formerly known as the Winter Soldier, is given the name [White Wolf](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/White_Wolf_(comics) "White Wolf (comics)") by the people of Wakanda, who helped remove his [Hydra](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hydra_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Hydra (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") programming.[[20]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTS-22)
*   [Tom Hiddleston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Hiddleston "Tom Hiddleston") as [Loki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Loki (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

Thor's adopted brother, based on the Norse mythological deity [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Loki "Loki").[[36]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HiddlestonInfinity-38) Hiddleston knew about Loki's death in _Infinity War_ prior to production of _Thor: Ragnarok_ after meeting the Russos in May 2016, with his death being the first scene of the film that the Russos had conceptualized.[[37]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HiddlestonDigitalSpy-39) Hiddleston's knowledge of Loki's fate in _Infinity War_ influenced his portrayal in _Ragnarok_. On Loki's final moments, Hiddleston believed it was "very powerful" that Loki calls himself "Odinson", as it was a moment that "closes the whole journey of Loki", while his death "takes the stakes up dramatically", establishing the threat of Thanos.[[38]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HiddlestonRagnarok-40)
*   [Idris Elba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Idris_Elba "Idris Elba") as [Heimdall](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heimdall_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Heimdall (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): The all-seeing, all-hearing Asgardian and former sentry of the [Bifröst Bridge](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bifr%C3%B6st_Bridge "Bifröst Bridge"), based on the Norse mythological deity [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heimdall "Heimdall").[[39]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Elba-41)
*   [Peter Dinklage](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Dinklage "Peter Dinklage") as [Eitri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eitri_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Eitri (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): King of the [Dwarves](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dwarves_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Dwarves (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") of [Nidavellir](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nidavellir_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nidavellir (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), and weaponsmith, based on the Norse mythological dwarf [of the same name](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eitri "Eitri").[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandDinklage-42)
*   [Benedict Wong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benedict_Wong "Benedict Wong") as [Wong](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wong_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Wong (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): A Master of the Mystic Arts, tasked with protecting some of [Kamar-Taj](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kamar-Taj "Kamar-Taj")'s most valuable relics and books.[[41]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Wong-43)
*   [Pom Klementieff](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pom_Klementieff "Pom Klementieff") as [Mantis](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mantis_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Mantis (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): A member of the Guardians with empathic powers.[[42]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Klementieff-44)
*   [Karen Gillan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Karen_Gillan "Karen Gillan") as [Nebula](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nebula_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nebula (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): An adopted daughter of Thanos who was raised with Gamora as siblings.[[43]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Gillan-45)
*   [Dave Bautista](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dave_Bautista "Dave Bautista") as [Drax the Destroyer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drax_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Drax (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A member of the Guardians and warrior in search of vengeance against Thanos for killing his family.[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewPremise-26) At the end of each day of filming, Bautista would have to sit in a sauna to remove his makeup.[[44]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BautistaMakeup-46)
*   [Zoe Saldaña](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Zoe_Salda%C3%B1a "Zoe Saldaña") as [Gamora](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gamora_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Gamora (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): A member of the Guardians who is an orphan from an alien world and was subsequently raised by Thanos, and is seeking redemption for her past crimes.[[45]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Saldana-47)[Ariana Greenblatt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ariana_Greenblatt "Ariana Greenblatt") portrays a young Gamora.[[46]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Greenblatt-48)
*   [Vin Diesel](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vin_Diesel "Vin Diesel") as [Groot](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Groot_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Groot (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A member of the Guardians who is a tree-like humanoid.[[47]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DieselConfirm-49) Executive producer [James Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/James_Gunn "James Gunn") explained that Groot is still an adolescent in the film, in the same state of growth seen in one of the [post-credit scenes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Post-credit_scene "Post-credit scene") in _[Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Guardians\_of\_the\_Galaxy\_Vol.\_2 "Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2")_ (2017).[[48]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-AdolescentGroot-50)[Terry Notary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Notary "Terry Notary") provided [motion capture](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Motion_capture "Motion capture") for Groot, and said the character is "coming of age, so you'll see the teenager find a mentor to look up to and to model himself after".[[49]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NotaryGroot-51)
*   [Bradley Cooper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bradley_Cooper "Bradley Cooper") as [Rocket](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rocket_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Rocket (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

A member of the Guardians who is a genetically engineered [raccoon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Raccoon "Raccoon")-based bounty hunter, mercenary, and master of weapons and battle tactics.[[50]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VultureD23Footage-52)[Sean Gunn](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sean_Gunn "Sean Gunn") was again the stand-in for Rocket during filming, with his acting and expressions serving as motion reference for the character.[[51]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SeanGunn-53)[[52]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SeanGunnMotionReference-54)
*   [Gwyneth Paltrow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gwyneth_Paltrow "Gwyneth Paltrow") as [Pepper Potts](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepper_Potts_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Pepper Potts (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

Stark's fiancée and the CEO of [Stark Industries](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stark_Industries "Stark Industries").[[53]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Paltrow-55) Downey felt that "Pepper remains the heart of the [Iron Man] story", which was not a focal point in some of the preceding films with Stark. Downey continued that "we wanted to get back to that reality. Not just for them, but let's really see how that can add to the something-worth-fighting-for of it all".[[9]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DowneyEW-11)
*   [Benicio del Toro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Benicio_del_Toro "Benicio del Toro") as [Taneleer Tivan / The Collector](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Taneleer_Tivan_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Taneleer Tivan (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): One of the [Elders of the Universe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Elders_of_the_Universe "Elders of the Universe") who is an obsessive keeper of the largest collection of interstellar fauna, relics, and species of all manner in the galaxy.[[54]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-delToro-56)
*   [Josh Brolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josh_Brolin "Josh Brolin") as [Thanos](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thanos_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thanos (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

An intergalactic warlord from [Titan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titan_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Titan (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") who seeks all six Infinity Stones to destroy half of all life[[55]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinInfinity-57)[[24]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewPremise-26)[[56]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTSPg2-58) for the sake of "re-balanc[ing] the universe".[[57]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-McFeelyFeb2017-59) Producer [Kevin Feige](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Feige "Kevin Feige") added that Thanos believes the universe is becoming over-populated, which led to the destruction of his home moon Titan and is something he vowed not to let happen again,[[56]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTSPg2-58) and also said "you could almost go so far as to say he is the main character of" the film.[[58]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ThanosMainCharacter-60) McFeely shared this sentiment, describing the film as his "hero journey" in addition to being the film's protagonist, stating, "Part of that is the things that [mean] the most to him. We wanted to show that. It wasn't just power; it wasn't just an ideal; it was people".[[26]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WritersEnding-28) Brolin likened Thanos to "the [Quasimodo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quasimodo "Quasimodo") of this time" and the novel _[Perfume](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Perfume\_(novel) "Perfume (novel)")_, since Thanos was born deformed and considered a "freak" on Titan,[[59]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinEW-61) while Joe Russo would reference _[The Godfather](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Godfather "The Godfather")_ (1972) for Brolin at times, which Brolin felt helped "to emotionalize the whole thing".[[60]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinGodfather-62) Brolin further added that he preferred playing Thanos over [Cable](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cable_(character) "Cable (character)") in _[Deadpool 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deadpool\_2 "Deadpool 2")_ (2018) because of the amount of work that went into creating the character.[[61]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ThanosCable-63) Thanos does not wear armor for most of the film, which is symbolic of his growing power as he collects the Infinity Stones.[[62]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ThanosArmor-64) In addition to voicing for the character, Brolin performed motion capture on set.[[63]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinMoCap-65)
*   [Chris Pratt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Pratt "Chris Pratt") as [Peter Quill / Star-Lord](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Quill_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Peter Quill (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"): 

The half-human, half-[Celestial](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Celestials_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Celestials (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") leader of the Guardians who was abducted from Earth as a child and raised by a group of alien thieves and smugglers called the [Ravagers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ravagers_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ravagers (Marvel Cinematic Universe)").[[33]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PrattOlsen-35) Pratt described his role in the film as a "guest star" appearance and said "you get to be a little more vibrant; a little more irreverent; a little bit more colorful if you want it to be".[[64]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-TorontoSunMar2018-66)

Additionally, several other actors reprise their MCU roles: [Danai Gurira](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Danai_Gurira "Danai Gurira") as [Okoye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Okoye_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Okoye (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the head of the [Dora Milaje](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dora_Milaje_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Dora Milaje (Marvel Cinematic Universe)");[[65]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Gurira-67)[Letitia Wright](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Letitia_Wright "Letitia Wright") as T'Challa's sister [Shuri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shuri_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Shuri (Marvel Cinematic Universe)");[[66]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Wright-68)[William Hurt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/William_Hurt "William Hurt") as [Thaddeus Ross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thaddeus_Ross_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Thaddeus Ross (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the [U.S. Secretary of State](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/U.S._Secretary_of_State "U.S. Secretary of State");[[67]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Hurt-69)[Kerry Condon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kerry_Condon "Kerry Condon") as the voice of Stark's AI [F.R.I.D.A.Y.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/F.R.I.D.A.Y._(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "F.R.I.D.A.Y. (Marvel Cinematic Universe)");[[68]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Condon-70)[Winston Duke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Winston_Duke "Winston Duke") as [M'Baku](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/M%27Baku_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "M'Baku (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the leader of Wakanda's mountain tribe the Jabari; [Florence Kasumba](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Florence_Kasumba "Florence Kasumba") as [Ayo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayo_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ayo (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), a member of the Dora Milaje;[[69]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DukeKasumba-71)[Jacob Batalon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jacob_Batalon "Jacob Batalon") as Parker's friend [Ned](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ned_Leeds_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ned Leeds (Marvel Cinematic Universe)");[[70]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Batalon-72)[Isabella Amara](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Isabella_Amara "Isabella Amara") as Parker's classmate [Sally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sally_Avril_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Sally Avril (Marvel Cinematic Universe)");[[71]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Amara-73)[Tiffany Espensen](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiffany_Espensen "Tiffany Espensen") as Parker's classmate [Cindy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cindy_Moon_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Cindy Moon (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"); and [Ethan Dizon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ethan_Dizon "Ethan Dizon") as Parker's classmate [Tiny](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tiny_McKeever_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Tiny McKeever (Marvel Cinematic Universe)").[[72]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BFI-74)[Samuel L. Jackson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samuel_L._Jackson "Samuel L. Jackson") and [Cobie Smulders](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cobie_Smulders "Cobie Smulders") make uncredited cameos as [Nick Fury](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nick_Fury_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Nick Fury (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and [Maria Hill](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Hill_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Maria Hill (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the former director and deputy director of S.H.I.E.L.D., respectively, in the film's post-credits scene.[[73]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-JacksonSmulders-75)

Thanos' henchmen, known collectively in the comics as the [Black Order](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Black_Order_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Black Order (Marvel Cinematic Universe)") and in the film as the "Children of Thanos",[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ChildrenOfThanos-76) include [Terry Notary](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Terry_Notary "Terry Notary") as [Cull Obsidian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cull_Obsidian "Cull Obsidian"),[[75]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Notary-77)[[76]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Coon-78)[Tom Vaughan-Lawlor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Vaughan-Lawlor "Tom Vaughan-Lawlor") as [Ebony Maw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ebony_Maw_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Ebony Maw (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"),[[77]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Vaughan-Lawlor-79)[[78]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Vaughan-Lawlor2-80)[Carrie Coon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carrie_Coon "Carrie Coon") as [Proxima Midnight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proxima_Midnight_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Proxima Midnight (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"),[[76]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Coon-78) and [Michael James Shaw](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_James_Shaw "Michael James Shaw") as [Corvus Glaive](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Corvus_Glaive_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Corvus Glaive (Marvel Cinematic Universe)").[[79]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MichaelShaw-81) The foursome provided voices and motion-capture performances on set for their characters.[[80]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BlackOrderMoCap-82)[[79]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MichaelShaw-81) As Coon was pregnant during filming, she mainly did facial capture for Proxima Midnight with some motion-capture,[[81]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-CoonEW-83) with stuntwoman [Monique Ganderton](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Monique_Ganderton "Monique Ganderton") standing-in and providing the rest on set.[[72]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BFI-74) Ebony Maw's look was inspired by the Marvel Comics character [Mephisto](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mephisto_(comics) "Mephisto (comics)"), who appeared in the _Infinity Gauntlet_ storyline.[[82]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MawMephisto-84)

[Ross Marquand](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ross_Marquand "Ross Marquand") voices [Johann Schmidt / Red Skull](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_Skull_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Red Skull (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), the "Stonekeeper" and former [Nazi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nazi_Party "Nazi Party") commander of Hydra during [World War II](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_War_II "World War II").[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandDinklage-42)[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RedSkullIW-85)[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandVoice-86) Marquand replaces [Hugo Weaving](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugo_Weaving "Hugo Weaving"), who had expressed reluctance to reprise the character from _[Captain America: The First Avenger](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain\_America:\_The\_First\_Avenger "Captain America: The First Avenger")_ (2011).[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandDinklage-42)[[83]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RedSkullIW-85) Red Skull was created through CGI and portrayed with [stand-ins](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stand-ins "Stand-ins") on set.[[84]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandVoice-86) Avengers co-creator [Stan Lee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stan_Lee "Stan Lee") makes a cameo appearance in the film as Parker's school bus driver,[[40]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarquandDinklage-42) while screenwriter [Stephen McFeely](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephen_McFeely "Stephen McFeely") cameos as Secretary Ross' aide.[[85]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-McFeelyCameo-87)[Kenneth Branagh](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kenneth_Branagh "Kenneth Branagh"), the director of _[Thor](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Thor\_(film) "Thor (film)")_ (2011), voices an Asgardian distress caller in an uncredited cameo.[[86]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Branagh-88)[David Cross](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/David_Cross "David Cross") was invited to make a cameo appearance as [Tobias Fünke](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tobias_F%C3%BCnke "Tobias Fünke"), his character from the television sitcom _[Arrested Development](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arrested\_Development\_(TV\_series) "Arrested Development (TV series)")_, which the Russo brothers had previously worked on; this was prevented by a scheduling conflict, but Fünke still appears in the film as a specimen in the Collector's collection, played by an uncredited extra.[[87]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-CrossCameo-89) Executive producer [Jon Favreau](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jon_Favreau "Jon Favreau") was to reprise his role as [Happy Hogan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Happy_Hogan_(Marvel_Cinematic_Universe) "Happy Hogan (Marvel Cinematic Universe)"), while co-director Joe Russo had a cameo appearance as a paparazzi photographer, but this scene did not make the theatrical cut of the film.[[88]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FavreauDeletedScene-90)

Production
----------

In October 2014, [Marvel Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Studios "Marvel Studios") announced a two-part sequel to _[Avengers: Age of Ultron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Age\_of\_Ultron "Avengers: Age of Ultron")_ (2015) entitled _Avengers: Infinity War_. _Part 1_ was scheduled to be released on May 4, 2018, with _Part 2_ scheduled for May 3, 2019.[[89]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-InfinityWar-91) Marvel's plan was to film both parts of _Infinity War_[back-to-back](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Back-to-back_film_production "Back-to-back film production").[[90]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BackToBackFilming-92)[Anthony and Joe Russo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Anthony_and_Joe_Russo "Anthony and Joe Russo") were hired to direct the films in April 2015.[[91]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Russos-93) The next month, [Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Christopher_Markus_and_Stephen_McFeely "Christopher Markus and Stephen McFeely") signed on to write the screenplays for both parts of the film,[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarkusMcFeely-94) which drew inspiration from [Jim Starlin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jim_Starlin "Jim Starlin")'s 1991 _[The Infinity Gauntlet](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Infinity\_Gauntlet "The Infinity Gauntlet")_ comic and [Jonathan Hickman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jonathan_Hickman "Jonathan Hickman")'s 2013 _[Infinity](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infinity\_(comic\_book) "Infinity (comic book)")_ comic.[[93]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Influences-95) Anthony Russo added the film was inspired by 1990s [heist films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heist_films "Heist films"), with Thanos "on a smash-and-grab" to acquire all of the Infinity Stones.[[56]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EWBTSPg2-58) Producer [Kevin Feige](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Feige "Kevin Feige") said the films would be "two distinct" projects with shared elements, not [one story split across two films](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_films_split_into_multiple_parts "List of films split into multiple parts").[[94]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FeigeApril2015-96) The Russos decided to rename them to remove this misconception in May 2016,[[95]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Retitled-97) and Marvel simply shortened the first film to _Avengers: Infinity War_ that July.[[96]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Retitled2-98)

[Principal photography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Principal_photography "Principal photography") began on January 23, 2017,[[97]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FilmingStart-99) under the [working title](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Working_title "Working title")_Mary Lou_,[[98]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WorkingTitle-100) at [Pinewood Atlanta Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pinewood_Atlanta_Studios "Pinewood Atlanta Studios") in [Fayette County, Georgia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fayette_County,_Georgia "Fayette County, Georgia"),[[99]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Pinewood-101) with [Trent Opaloch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Trent_Opaloch "Trent Opaloch") as [director of photography](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Director_of_photography "Director of photography").[[100]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Atlanta-102)_Infinity War_ and _[Avengers: Endgame](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:\_Endgame "Avengers: Endgame")_ were shot using ARRI Alexa IMAX 2D cameras, thus marking the first time that a [Hollywood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinema_of_the_United_States "Cinema of the United States") feature film was shot entirely with IMAX digital cameras.[[101]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRIMAX-103) In early February, Marvel confirmed the involvement of [Robert Downey Jr.](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_Downey_Jr. "Robert Downey Jr.") as Tony Stark / Iron Man, [Chris Pratt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Pratt "Chris Pratt") as Peter Quill / Star-Lord, and [Tom Holland](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Holland "Tom Holland") as Peter Parker / Spider-Man in the film.[[8]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Holland-10) Additional filming took place in Scotland beginning in February 2017. The filming occurred in Edinburgh, [Glasgow](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glasgow "Glasgow"), and the [Scottish Highlands](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Scottish_Highlands "Scottish Highlands"),[[102]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Scotland-104) with studio work taking place at [Wardpark Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wardpark_Studios "Wardpark Studios") in [Cumbernauld](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cumbernauld "Cumbernauld").[[103]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Wardpark-105) In late June 2017, filming occurred in [Downtown Atlanta](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Downtown_Atlanta "Downtown Atlanta"),[[104]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DowntownAtlantaFilming-106) as well as Atlanta's [Central Park](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Central_Park_(Atlanta) "Central Park (Atlanta)") in early July,[[105]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-AtlCentralPark-107) before moving to [Queens, New York](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Queens,_New_York "Queens, New York") in the middle of the month.[[106]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-QueensFilming-108) Filming concluded on July 14, 2017.[[107]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FilmingEnd-109) For the film's final scene, where Thanos settles in a [nipa hut](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nipa_hut "Nipa hut"), the filmmakers worked with Thailand-based studio [Indochina Productions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indochina_Productions "Indochina Productions") to acquire footage of the [Banaue Rice Terraces](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Banaue_Rice_Terraces "Banaue Rice Terraces") at [Ifugao, Philippines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ifugao,_Philippines "Ifugao, Philippines").[[108]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PhilippinesFilming-110)

Later in July 2017, Joe Russo stated there were a couple of unfinished scenes for _Infinity War_ that would be shot "in the next few months".[[109]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-AdditionalShooting-111) In early March 2018, Disney moved the release of _Infinity War_ in the United States to April 27, 2018, to have it be released the same weekend as some of its international markets.[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewReleaseDate-112)[[111]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewReleaseDate2-113) Visual effects for the film were created by [Industrial Light & Magic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Industrial_Light_%26_Magic "Industrial Light & Magic"),[[112]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ILM-114)[Framestore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Framestore "Framestore"),[[113]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Framestore-115)[Method Studios](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Method_Studios "Method Studios"),[[114]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MethodStudios-116)[Weta Digital](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Weta_Digital "Weta Digital"), [DNEG](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DNEG "DNEG"), [Cinesite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cinesite "Cinesite"), [Digital Domain](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_Domain "Digital Domain"), Rise, [Lola VFX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lola_VFX "Lola VFX"), and Perception.[[115]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ArtofVFX-117) With an estimated budget in the range of $325–400 million,[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineProfit-2)[[3]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VarietyBudget-3) it is one of the [most expensive films ever made](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most_expensive_films "List of most expensive films").[[116]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MostExpensive-118) Evans and Hemsworth both earned $15 million for the film.[[117]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EvansHemsworthPay-119)

Music
-----

In June 2016, [Alan Silvestri](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alan_Silvestri "Alan Silvestri"), who composed the score for _[The Avengers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Avengers\_(2012\_film) "The Avengers (2012 film)")_ (2012), was revealed to be returning to score both _Infinity War_ and _Endgame_.[[118]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Silvestri-120) Silvestri recorded his score from January 2018[[119]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ScoreRecording-121) to late March, and found working on the film to be "a really different experience than anything I'd done before, especially in regard to the approach and balancing quick shifts in tone".[[120]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SilvestriApr2018-122)[Ludwig Göransson](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ludwig_G%C3%B6ransson "Ludwig Göransson")'s theme from _Black Panther_ is used in the film.[[121]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SilvestriTHRApr2018-123)[Hollywood Records](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood_Records "Hollywood Records") and [Marvel Music](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Music_(record_label) "Marvel Music (record label)") released regular and deluxe soundtrack albums digitally on April 27, 2018, with physical releases on May 18. The deluxe edition featured some extended and additional tracks.[[122]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Soundtrack-124)

Marketing
---------

[![Image 2](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/bd/Avengers_Infinity_War_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg/250px-Avengers_Infinity_War_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Avengers_Infinity_War_by_Gage_Skidmore.jpg)

From left to right: [Kevin Feige](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Feige "Kevin Feige"), [Chris Hemsworth](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chris_Hemsworth "Chris Hemsworth"), [Tom Hiddleston](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tom_Hiddleston "Tom Hiddleston"), [Chadwick Boseman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chadwick_Boseman "Chadwick Boseman"), and [Mark Ruffalo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mark_Ruffalo "Mark Ruffalo") at the 2017 [San Diego Comic-Con](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego Comic-Con")

In May 2017, Robert Downey Jr. and his philanthropic organization Random Act Funding partnered with [Omaze](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Omaze "Omaze") for a contest in which a randomly chosen winner from those that donated would receive an _Infinity War_ set visit.[[123]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Omaze-125) A life-sized statue of Thanos, created by [Legacy Effects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Legacy_Effects "Legacy Effects"), was on display at [D23 Expo 2017](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/D23_Expo_2017 "D23 Expo 2017"),[[124]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ThanoStatueD23-126) alongside statues of the Black Order / "Children of Thanos": Corvus Glaive, Proxima Midnight, Ebony Maw, and Cull Obsidian.[[74]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ChildrenOfThanos-76) Additionally, Feige, Joe Russo, Downey, Brolin, Bettany, Olsen, Klementieff, Gillan, Bautista, Cheadle, Mackie, Cumberbatch, Stan, Holland, Boseman, Ruffalo, and Hemsworth appeared at D23 Expo to present a clip highlighting the 10 years of MCU films, along with footage from _Infinity War_.[[28]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-D232017-30) The footage, which was screened exclusively for the panel,[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRD23Footage-127) received strong audience reaction, with fans "literally on their feet and jumping as the footage played".[[125]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRD23Footage-127)[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PolygonD23Footage-128) Julia Alexander of _[Polygon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Polygon\_(website) "Polygon (website)")_ said there was "quite a bit happening" in the footage and it "finally feels like Marvel has made the movie it always wanted to—and the one we've always wanted to see."[[126]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PolygonD23Footage-128)[CinemaBlend](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CinemaBlend "CinemaBlend")'s Eric Eisenberg said the footage left him "literally shaking", with the film looking "like it could be one of the most epic blockbusters ever created".[[127]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-CinemaBlendD23Footage-129) Haleigh Foutch for _[Collider](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Collider\_(website) "Collider (website)")_ described it as "dark and dramatic, and utterly epic. It's clear Marvel is trying to do something different here [...] to pay off a decade's worth of narrative and [world-building](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World-building "World-building"). While it's impossible to tell from two minutes work of footage, it certainly looks like that gamble paid off".[[128]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ColliderD23Footage-130) The D23 footage was also shown at the 2017 [San Diego Comic-Con](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_Diego_Comic-Con "San Diego Comic-Con").[[129]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SDCCFootage-131) After the two convention presentations, _Avengers: Infinity War_ generated over 90,000 new conversations on social media from July 17 to 23, the third-most during that time period behind _Thor: Ragnarok_ and _[Justice League](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justice\_League\_(film) "Justice League (film)")_ (2017), according to [Comscore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Comscore "Comscore") and its PreAct service.[[130]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-comScoreComicCon-132)_Infinity War_ stayed in third the following week, with over 41,000 new social media conversations, behind _Ragnarok_ and _[It](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/It\_(2017\_film) "It (2017 film)")_ (2017).[[131]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-comScoreJuly31-133) By the week of October 16, _Infinity War_ had generated over 679,000 total social media conversations.[[132]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-comScoreOct16-134)

To promote the film's first [teaser trailer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Teaser_trailer "Teaser trailer"), Marvel released a compilation video of some of its previous trailers since _[Iron Man](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Iron\_Man\_(2008\_film) "Iron Man (2008 film)")_ (2008), "paired with fan reaction videos to those trailers".[[133]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RetrospectiveVideo-135) The first teaser for _Avengers: Infinity War_ debuted on _[Good Morning America](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Good\_Morning\_America "Good Morning America")_ on November 29, 2017.[[134]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FirstTrailer-136) Josh Spiegel of _[The Hollywood Reporter](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Hollywood\_Reporter "The Hollywood Reporter")_ said, "The most important part of the trailer is how it carefully, deliberately introduces the notion that the _Infinity War_ films are going to function as a passing of the torch, from one set of Avengers to a newer group".[[135]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Spiegel_trailer-137) Scott Mendelson, writing for _[Forbes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Forbes "Forbes")_, noted that even though the trailer was not much different from the convention footage screened earlier in the year, it was "damn impressive." Additionally, the trailer had an "excellent effect", using the "Avengers Initiative speech" by Nick Fury and the "Avengers theme" by Alan Silvestri from _The Avengers_.[[136]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ForbesTrailer-138) Conversely to Mendelson, Alexander commented on the different marketing strategy for the film between the convention footage scenes and the trailer scenes, feeling the "two couldn't be more different". She said the convention footage (intended to please the crowd who were "jittery with anticipation") was released between _Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2_ and _Thor: Ragnarok_, and heavily focused Thor and the Guardians, while the trailer (designed to explain the film to general audiences) heavily features Black Panther and Wakanda, which Alexander said could not have been done before the additional marketing for _Black Panther_ that happened after the conventions provided additional context.[[137]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PolygonTrailer-139) Gael Cooper of [CNET](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CNET "CNET") observed that the trailer was viewed nearly 500,000 times in its first 15 minutes after it was posted on [YouTube](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/YouTube "YouTube"), but questioned if the trailer broke the site after the view counter appeared to be stuck at 467,331.[[138]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Cooper_trailer-140) The trailer was viewed 230 million times in its first 24 hours, becoming the most viewed trailer in that time period, surpassing the record of _It_.[[139]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-TrailerViews-141)

In January 2018, Marvel Comics published a [two-issue prequel comic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe_tie-in_comics "Marvel Cinematic Universe tie-in comics") titled _Avengers: Infinity War Prelude_, which serves as a bridge between _Captain America: Civil War_ and _Avengers: Infinity War_.[[140]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PreludeComic-142) A commercial for _Infinity War_ aired during [Super Bowl LII](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Super_Bowl_LII "Super Bowl LII"), and generated the most social media buzz of all the films advertised according to comScore and [United Talent Agency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/United_Talent_Agency "United Talent Agency"); it was viewed 17.6 million times across YouTube and [Facebook](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facebook "Facebook").[[141]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SuperBowl-143) On February 27, Disney and Marvel announced the "Marvel: The Universe Unites" charity campaign leading to the release of merchandise for the film on March 3. The week-long event saw stars from the film create social media challenges to provide funds and raise awareness for charities that support children and families impacted by serious illness. Marvel planned to make a $250,000 donation to [Starlight Children's Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Starlight_Children%27s_Foundation "Starlight Children's Foundation") if these posts collectively reached 1 million likes, while Disney planned to donate 10% of all Marvel's [Disney Store](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disney_Store "Disney Store") sales in the United States and online on the weekend of March 3 to the [Make-A-Wish Foundation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Make-A-Wish_Foundation "Make-A-Wish Foundation"), up to $50,000. [Hasbro](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hasbro "Hasbro") and [Funko](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Funko "Funko") each donated $1 million worth of cash and products, to [Give Kids the World Village](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Give_Kids_the_World_Village "Give Kids the World Village") and Starlight Children's Foundation, respectively.[[142]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-UniverseUnitesCampaign-144)

A second trailer was released on March 16, which earned over 1 million views on YouTube in less than three hours after it was released.[[143]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Trailer2InitialViews-145) Alyssa Rosenberg of _[The Washington Post](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Washington\_Post "The Washington Post")_ was not overly enthused about another superhero film having "special-effects-heavy villains, or the sight of yet _another_ mysterious object hanging over the Manhattan skyline", but felt the trailer made her realize "that I'm actually looking forward to seeing [the characters of the MCU] get to know each other".[[144]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WPTrailer2-146) Spiegel agreed with Rosenberg about the potential for character interactions, but felt it was "gimmicky" to have so many "crossover-style introductions or combinations of heroes in a movie like this".[[145]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRTrailer2-147) The second trailer was viewed 179 million times in the first 24 hours, the third-most viewed trailer in that time period, behind the first trailer for the film and _It_, while also becoming the biggest release for a second trailer, surpassing _[Beauty and the Beast](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Beauty\_and\_the\_Beast\_(2017\_film) "Beauty and the Beast (2017 film)")_ (2017) (128 million views).[[146]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Trailer2Views-148) A week before the film's release, the [Burj Khalifa](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Burj_Khalifa "Burj Khalifa") in Dubai was lit up each night for the film, counting down to its release.[[147]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BurjKhalifa-149) Marvel also featured tie-in events across seven of their mobile games to promote the film.[[148]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarvelGamesTieIn-150) In early May, Marvel and [Epic Games](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Epic_Games "Epic Games") announced the "Infinity Gauntlet Limited Time Mashup" mode for _[Fortnite Battle Royale](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fortnite\_Battle\_Royale "Fortnite Battle Royale")_, where players could find the Infinity Gauntlet hidden on the game map and become Thanos with added abilities. The Russo brothers were fans of _Fortnite_ and approached Donald Mustard, the worldwide creative director of Epic Games, about the potential for a crossover between the properties.[[149]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FortniteCrossover-151) On November 20, [Little, Brown and Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little,_Brown_and_Company "Little, Brown and Company") published _Marvel's Avengers: Infinity War: Thanos – Titan Consumed_, written by [Barry Lyga](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Barry_Lyga "Barry Lyga"). Despite not existing within Marvel Studios' MCU canon, the novel explores the origins of Thanos before the events of the film. Lyga spoke with Marvel Studios to get an "outline of who Thanos is and what he means to the movies", and "was given great latitude and a free hand [in some areas of the story], while in others I had to tip-toe very carefully through the MCU".[[150]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ThanosNovel-152)

All-in-all, the studio spent an estimated $150 million on prints and advertisements promoting the film.[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineProfit-2) Additional marketing partners for the film included [Coca-Cola](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coca-Cola "Coca-Cola"), [Quicken Loans](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quicken_Loans "Quicken Loans") and their Rocket Mortgage service, the [Infiniti QX50](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Infiniti_QX50 "Infiniti QX50") (which appears in the film), [Ziploc](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ziploc "Ziploc"), [Go-Gurt](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Go-Gurt "Go-Gurt"), [Yoplait](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Yoplait "Yoplait"), [Synchrony Bank](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Synchrony_Bank "Synchrony Bank"), [American Airlines](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/American_Airlines "American Airlines"), and [Stand Up to Cancer](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stand_Up_to_Cancer "Stand Up to Cancer"). The partners created television commercials "inspired by or featuring the film's characters and themes", interactive digital initiatives, and robust in-store presences at numerous retailers.
