[Duracell](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Duracell "Duracell"), [Unilever](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Unilever "Unilever"), [Quaker Oats Company](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Quaker_Oats_Company "Quaker Oats Company"), [Chevron](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chevron_Corporation "Chevron Corporation"), and [Samsung](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Samsung "Samsung") ran promotions in smaller markets. Coca-Cola, Ziploc, Go-Gurt, and Yoplait created special packaging in support of the film, with Synchrony implementing a "Save Like a Hero" campaign, and Stand Up to Cancer and American Airlines launching a national campaign with a [PSA](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Public_service_announcement "Public service announcement") starring Johansson and Hemsworth. In the United Kingdom, [OnePlus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/OnePlus "OnePlus") released an _Infinity War_ edition for one of their smartphones. _[Deadline Hollywood](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Deadline\_Hollywood "Deadline Hollywood")_ estimated the media value was $150 million, the largest for any Marvel film, with Coca-Cola contributing an estimated $40 million.[[151]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarketingPartners-153)

Release
-------

### Theatrical

_Avengers: Infinity War_ held its world premiere at the [Dolby Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dolby_Theatre "Dolby Theatre") in [Hollywood, Los Angeles](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hollywood,_Los_Angeles "Hollywood, Los Angeles"), on April 23, 2018, screening also at the adjacent [El Capitan Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/El_Capitan_Theatre "El Capitan Theatre") and [Grauman's Chinese Theatre](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Grauman%27s_Chinese_Theatre "Grauman's Chinese Theatre").[[152]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WorldPremiere2-154)[[153]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WorldPremiere1-155) It was released in most countries worldwide, including the United States, on April 27, with a few debuts beginning as early as April 25,[[110]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewReleaseDate-112) and was shown in [IMAX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IMAX "IMAX") and [3D](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/3D_film "3D film") on select screens.[[154]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-IMAXRelease-156)[[155]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-3DRelease-157) In the United States, the film opened in 4,474 theaters, 408 of which were IMAX; this was the widest release for a Disney title ever and the second-widest ever after _[Despicable Me 3](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Despicable\_Me\_3 "Despicable Me 3")_'s (2017) 4,529 theaters. Three of [AMC Theatres](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/AMC_Theatres "AMC Theatres")' locations screened the film for 24 hours straight, with 53 of their locations having showtimes at either 2 am or 3 am to accommodate demand.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158) In India, the film had the biggest release ever for a Hollywood film, opening on nearly 2,000 screens in four languages.[[157]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-IndiaRelease-159) The film also screened in 515 [4DX](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/4DX "4DX") theaters in 59 countries.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd2-160)_Avengers: Infinity War_ was originally scheduled to be released on May 4 in the United States.[[89]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-InfinityWar-91) The Chinese release of the film, which opened on May 11,[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd2-161) was originally scheduled to end on June 10, but was granted a "rare" extension of 30 days, to end on July 9.[[160]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ChinaExtension-162)_Avengers: Infinity War_ is part of [Phase Three](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marvel_Cinematic_Universe:_Phase_Three "Marvel Cinematic Universe: Phase Three") of the MCU.[[161]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PhaseThree-163)

Select footage from the film was screened in various cities during the film's press tour in early April, ahead of the Los Angeles premiere. The Russos said only a limited amount of the film would be shown at these screenings to reduce the chance of spoilers being leaked. Adam Chitwood of _Collider_ commented that this was "highly unusual as most Marvel movies are screened in their entirety for press about a month before they hit theaters".[[162]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PressTourFootage-164) Ahead of the United States release, AMC Theatres in New York City and Orlando, Florida aired an eleven-MCU film marathon beginning on April 25, ending in a screening of _Infinity War_. The El Capitan Theatre in Los Angeles had a similar marathon for the film's release.[[163]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MCUMarathon-165)

### Home media

_Avengers: Infinity War_ was released on [digital download](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Digital_distribution "Digital distribution") by [Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walt_Disney_Studios_Home_Entertainment "Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment") on July 31, 2018, and on [Ultra HD Blu-ray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultra_HD_Blu-ray "Ultra HD Blu-ray"), [Blu-ray](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blu-ray "Blu-ray"), and [DVD](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DVD-Video "DVD-Video") on August 14. The digital and Blu-ray releases include behind-the-scenes featurettes, audio commentary, deleted scenes, and a blooper reel. The digital release also features a roundtable discussion between MCU directors the Russos, Jon Favreau, [Joss Whedon](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Joss_Whedon "Joss Whedon"), James Gunn, [Ryan Coogler](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryan_Coogler "Ryan Coogler"), [Peyton Reed](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peyton_Reed "Peyton Reed"), and Taika Waititi.[[164]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HomeMedia-166) In terms of home media sales, the physical versions of the film were collectively the top home media release of the week in which they were first released.[[165]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HomeMediaSales-167)

Despite being shot with IMAX cameras and released in IMAX theaters in the 1.90:1 [aspect ratio](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aspect_ratio "Aspect ratio"), the home media release did not present the film in that aspect ratio, instead including a cropped [2.39:1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2.39:1 "2.39:1") aspect ratio that was used for non-IMAX screenings.[[166]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ForbesBluRayRatio-168)[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SlashFilmColliderQ&A-169) Joe Russo said they "spent a long time trying to" have the IMAX version on the home media, but since the [IMAX Corporation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IMAX_Corporation "IMAX Corporation") has "agency over that format", the situation was "complicated".[[168]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SuperHeroHypeColliderQ&A-170) He did not rule out the possibility that this version could be available at a later point.[[167]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SlashFilmColliderQ&A-169) The IMAX Enhanced version of the film was made available on [Disney+](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Disney%2B "Disney+") beginning on November 12, 2021.[[169]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-IMAXEnhanced-171)

Reception
---------

### Box office

_Avengers: Infinity War_ grossed $678.8 million in the United States and Canada, and $1.374 billion in other territories, for a worldwide total of $2.052 billion,[[4]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BOM-4) becoming the [fourth-highest-grossing film of all time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films "List of highest-grossing films"),[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd4-172)[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-2Billion-173) the [highest-grossing film of 2018](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2018_in_film#Highest-grossing_films "2018 in film"),[[172]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Highest2018-174) the highest-grossing MCU film, and the [highest-grossing superhero film](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest_grossing_superhero_films#Top_50_superhero_movies_at_the_worldwide_box_office "List of highest grossing superhero films").[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd3-175)

Its worldwide opening weekend of $640.5 million was the [biggest of all time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_openings_for_films#Biggest_worldwide_openings_on_record "List of highest-grossing openings for films"), beating _[The Fate of the Furious](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Fate\_of\_the\_Furious "The Fate of the Furious")_'s (2017) $541.9 million.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158) It was later beat by its sequel, _Avengers: Endgame_, which grossed $1.222 billion in its opening weekend.[[174]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineINTEndgameOpening-176) It was the fastest film to make $1 billion at the worldwide box office, doing so in 11 days to eclipse _[Star Wars: The Force Awakens](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star\_Wars:\_The\_Force\_Awakens "Star Wars: The Force Awakens")_'s (2015) record of 12 days.[[175]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-1Billion-177) Also, in its second weekend, _Infinity War_ passed $13.5 million from 4DX screens, which was the all-time record for the format.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd2-160) On June 12, 2018, _Infinity War_ passed the $2 billion mark at the worldwide box office, becoming the fourth film to cross that milestone after _[Avatar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avatar\_(2009\_film) "Avatar (2009 film)")_ (2009), _[Titanic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Titanic\_(1997\_film) "Titanic (1997 film)")_ (1997), and _The Force Awakens_.[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-2Billion-173) Crossing the mark in 48 days, it was the second-fastest to that point, after _Avatar_'s 47-day record and later the 11-day record of _Endgame_.[[176]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-2BillionForbes-178) With $140 million worldwide from IMAX,[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd5-179) the film is the third-largest worldwide in the format, behind _Avatar_ and _The Force Awakens_,[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd4-172) and the largest for a Marvel film.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd3-180)_Deadline Hollywood_ calculated the film's net profit as $500 million, accounting for production budgets, marketing, talent participations, and other costs; box office grosses and home media revenues placed it first on their list of 2018's "Most Valuable Blockbusters".[[2]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineProfit-2)

#### Pre-sale ticket records

In December 2017, a survey from [Fandango](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fandango_Media "Fandango Media") indicated that _Infinity War_ was the most anticipated film of 2018.[[179]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FandangoSurvey-181) Fandango later reported that _Infinity War_ achieved the largest initial 24-hour ticket pre-sales for a superhero film, taking just 6 hours to surpass the previous 24-hour record set by _Black Panther_. Atom Tickets reported that _Infinity War_ sold more tickets in its first pre-sales day than _Black Panther_ sold in its first month.[[180]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FandangoAtomPresales-182) Within 72 hours, the film generated the largest pre-sales for any superhero film at AMC Theatres, with its advance ticket sales being 257.6% ahead of _Black Panther_'s, 751.5% ahead of _Captain America: Civil War_, and 1,106.5% ahead of _Avengers: Age of Ultron_ during the same time frame.[[181]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-AMCAdvanceTickets-183) Two weeks before its release, Fandango revealed that advance ticket sales for _Infinity War_ were outpacing the last seven MCU films combined in the same timeframe, and had become the company's top April release. It was also on pace to become the top superhero film.[[182]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-FandangoOutpacing-184) A week before the film released, _[The Wall Street Journal](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Wall\_Street\_Journal "The Wall Street Journal")_ said the film had sold more than $50 million worth of advance tickets, behind only _The Force Awakens_ and _[Star Wars: The Last Jedi](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Star\_Wars:\_The\_Last\_Jedi "Star Wars: The Last Jedi")_ (2017),[[183]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-WSJAdvancedTickets-185)[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158) with Fandango reporting that more than 2,500 showtimes had sold out. On Atom Tickets, _Infinity War_ had the most pre-sale volume, selling 7% higher than _The Last Jedi_ and 250% higher than _Black Panther_ at the same point in their sales. Atom also reported that ticket sales for _Infinity War_ were doubling daily the week of its release, the fastest rate of increase the service has seen for any MCU title.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158)

#### United States and Canada

_Avengers: Infinity War_ earned $106.7 million on its opening day in the United States and Canada (including $39 million from Thursday night previews), for an opening weekend total of $258.2 million. The Thursday night preview earning was the best for an MCU film (beating _Avengers: Age of Ultron_'s $27.6 million) and the fourth-best of all time, behind _The Force Awakens_ ($57 million), _The Last Jedi_ ($45 million), and _[Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows– Part 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry\_Potter\_and\_the\_Deathly\_Hallows\_%E2%80%93\_Part\_2 "Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows – Part 2")_ (2011) ($43.5 million). Fandango reported that $14 million of the $39 million came from ticket pre-sales from the company. The opening day gross was the second-best ever, behind _The Force Awakens_'s $119.1 million; its Saturday gross of $83 million was the best-ever Saturday gross, beating _[Jurassic World](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jurassic\_World "Jurassic World")_'s (2015) $69.6 million; and its Sunday gross of $69.2 million was the best-ever, beating _The Force Awakens_'s $60.5 million. The total weekend gross became the [highest-grossing opening weekend](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_openings_for_films#Biggest_openings_in_the_United_States_and_Canada "List of highest-grossing openings for films"), beating _The Force Awakens_'s $248 million. IMAX contributed $22.5 million to the opening weekend gross, which was the best opening for a Marvel film in the format and the third-biggest opening, behind _The Force Awakens_ ($30 million) and _The Last Jedi_ ($24.7 million). AMC reported that the film had the highest Friday and Saturday box office gross for a single title in the company's history, while Fandango reported that approximately $84 million worth of tickets were sold through the service, approximately 30%, which was the largest share of the weekend box office for any film in the company's history.[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158)_Avengers: Infinity War_ earned an additional $25 million the Monday after its opening weekend, which was the highest-grossing Monday in April, beating _[Furious 7](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Furious\_7 "Furious 7")_ (2015) ($14 million), and the second-best Monday gross for an MCU film, after _Black Panther_ ($40.1 million).[[184]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1Monday-186) The next day, it earned $23.5 million, which was the highest-grossing Tuesday for an MCU film, beating _Black Panther_ ($20.8 million), and the highest-grossing Tuesday in May, beating _The Avengers_ ($17.6 million). It also tied _The Force Awakens_ for the fastest to reach $300 million at five days.[[185]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1Tuesday-187)

The film remained number one in its second weekend, earning $115.5 million, which was the second-best second weekend ever after _The Force Awakens_ ($149.2 million). _Infinity War_ also surpassed $400 million in the weekend, doing so in nine days, becoming the second fastest film to reach that mark, again after _The Force Awakens_'s eight days.[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd2-160) In its third weekend, _Infinity War_ remained number one at the box office, and became the second-fastest film to surpass $500 million, doing so in 15 days (behind _The Force Awakens_'s 10 days). The weekend also saw its total domestic IMAX gross become $48.1 million, which was the highest for any MCU film.[[173]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd3-175) The film's fourth weekend saw it come in second, behind _Deadpool 2_,[[186]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd4-188) and in its fifth it finished third behind _[Solo: A Star Wars Story](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Solo:\_A\_Star\_Wars\_Story "Solo: A Star Wars Story")_ (2018) and _Deadpool 2_.[[187]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd5-189) By May 23, _Infinity War_ surpassed $600 million, becoming the second-fastest film to do so in 26 days, after _The Force Awakens_ (12 days).[[188]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-600Million-190) It remained in the top ten through its ninth weekend.[[189]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-TopTenRemain-191) In the United States and Canada, it went on to become the [fourth-highest-grossing film of all time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_highest-grossing_films_in_the_United_States_and_Canada "List of highest-grossing films in the United States and Canada"),[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-2Billion-173) and the second-highest-grossing superhero film, behind _Black Panther_.[[190]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BOMDom-192)

#### Other territories

Outside the United States and Canada, the film earned $382.7 million from 52 markets, opening number one in all, and became the number two opening internationally, behind _The Fate of the Furious_ ($444.2 million). IMAX contributed $18.5 million, which was the best opening outside of the US, Canada, and China, surpassing _The Force Awakens_ ($17.5 million).[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) All-time opening weekend records were set in South Korea ($39.2 million), Mexico ($25.4 million), Brazil ($19.1 million), India (for a Western release, $18.6 million), the Philippines ($12.5 million), Thailand ($10 million), Indonesia ($9.6 million), Malaysia,[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) Hong Kong, Vietnam,[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-194) Central America, Peru, Chile, Ecuador, Venezuela, Bolivia, South Africa, Turkey, the United Arab Emirates, and West Africa,[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) with many also setting opening day records.[[193]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BOMagOpeningDayRecords-195) France had the biggest superhero opening in the market with $17.7 million,[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) as did Denmark, Finland, Norway, Portugal, and Sweden. The United Kingdom earned $8.9 million, which was the biggest MCU opening day and third-highest opening day for a Disney film;[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-194) it would go on to earn $41.4 million for the weekend, which was the third-highest of all time and the second-highest Disney opening.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) Argentina had the second-highest opening day of all time, while Germany had the best superhero film opening day of all time,[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-194) ultimately earning $14.7 million, which was the best superhero opening ever.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193) Many other European countries and the Middle East also broke superhero film records.[[192]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-194) Japan had the second-biggest opening for an MCU film with $9 million, and Australia had the second-highest opening weekend ever, with $23.2 million.[[191]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1-2-193)

_Avengers: Infinity War_ remained number one in its 54 markets in its second weekend.[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd2-161) The $4.9 million opening day in Russia was the biggest of all time. However, there was some controversy with the film's release in that country. Originally, the [Russian government](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_government "Russian government") ordered it to be released on May 11, but after a scandal the government made concessions and agreed to let it premiere on May 3 with a condition that on May 9, during the [Victory Day](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Victory_Day_(9_May) "Victory Day (9 May)"), only Russian films would be played in the cinema theatres.[[194]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RussiaFun-196)_Infinity War_ was also the first film in Russia to sell more than 1 million tickets in a single day,[[195]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd1Mid-197) and went on to gross $17.6 million in the market, a new opening weekend record. IMAX contributed $2.2 million in the market, which was also an opening weekend record.[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd2-161) In its third weekend, the film remained number one in a majority of its markets. _Infinity War_ opened in China to $200 million (RMB 1.266 billion), which was the second-highest opening weekend in local currency behind _The Fate of the Furious_ ($184 million and RMB 1.352 million). IMAX contributed $20.5 million, which was the third-largest opening in China.[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd3-180)_Infinity War_ also broke China's pre-sale record of 400 million yuan ($63 million).[[196]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-ChinaPreSale-198) In India, _Infinity War_ became the first Hollywood film to earn over [₹](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Indian_rupee_sign "Indian rupee sign")2 billion net ($29.7 million),[[197]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-IndiaRecord-199) and also became the highest-grossing MCU film in the United Kingdom.[[198]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd3Early-200) In its sixth weekend, the film became the highest-grossing MCU film in Japan with $33 million.[[199]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd6-201)

The film became the highest-grossing release ever in Brazil, Indonesia, the Philippines, Central America, Bolivia, Venezuela, Latin America as a region, Mexico, Chile, Ecuador, Peru, Malaysia, Singapore, India (for a Western release), Vietnam, Indonesia, Thailand (for a Western release), and Mongolia,[[159]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd2-161)[[178]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd3-180)[[170]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd4-172)[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd5-179) the second-highest in the Asia-Pacific region (for a Western release), Hong Kong, and South Korea (for a Western release), and the third-highest in China (for a Western release). It is also the highest-grossing superhero film in many European countries, including the United Kingdom.[[177]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd5-179) As of June 17, 2018, the film's top markets are China ($373.4 million), the United Kingdom ($95.7 million), and South Korea ($92.8 million).[[200]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineIntWknd8-202) The film is the third-highest-grossing film of all time in territories outside the United States and Canada.[[171]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-2Billion-173)

### Critical response

[![Image 3](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ec/Josh_Brolin_SDCC_2014.jpg/250px-Josh_Brolin_SDCC_2014.jpg)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:Josh_Brolin_SDCC_2014.jpg)

[Josh Brolin](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Josh_Brolin "Josh Brolin")'s performance as Thanos was praised by many critics.[[201]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RTRoundUp-203)

The [review aggregator](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Review_aggregator "Review aggregator")[Rotten Tomatoes](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rotten_Tomatoes "Rotten Tomatoes") reported an approval rating of 85%, with an average score of 7.6/10, based on 492 reviews. The website's critical consensus reads, "_Avengers: Infinity War_ ably juggles a dizzying array of MCU heroes in the fight against their gravest threat yet, and the result is a thrilling, emotionally resonant blockbuster that (mostly) realizes its gargantuan ambitions."[[202]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-204)[Metacritic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Metacritic "Metacritic"), which uses a weighted average, assigned the film a score of 68 out of 100 based on 54 critics, indicating "generally favorable" reviews.[[203]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-205)

[Todd McCarthy](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Todd_McCarthy "Todd McCarthy") of _The Hollywood Reporter_ praised the writers' and directors' ability to balance the large cast of characters, saying they, "under the supervision of Marvel Films maestro Kevin Feige, acknowledge the traffic jam of egos and play it for laughs".[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRReview-206)[Owen Gleiberman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Owen_Gleiberman "Owen Gleiberman") of _[Variety](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variety\_(magazine) "Variety (magazine)")_ concurred, stating, "_Infinity War_ is a brashly entertaining jamboree, structured to show off each hero or heroine and give them just enough to do, and to update their mythologies without making it all feel like homework".[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VarietyReview-207)_[Rolling Stone](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Rolling\_Stone "Rolling Stone")_'s [Peter Travers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Peter_Travers "Peter Travers") said the film is "too much of a good thing" and wrote, "The Russo brothers have clearly never learned the concept that less is more. They've used the premise of an Avengers reunion to put on a fireworks explosion of action and laughs that won't quit".[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RollingStoneReview-208)[Richard Roeper](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Roeper "Richard Roeper") of the _[Chicago Sun-Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chicago\_Sun-Times "Chicago Sun-Times")_ called it Marvel's "biggest and most ambitious movie yet", but concluded "it's certainly not the best. However, there's plenty of action, humor and heart—and some genuinely effective dramatic moments". Roeper went on to praise the film's cast and Josh Brolin in particular, whom he called "the film's most interesting performance".[[207]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SunTimesReview-209) Gleiberman called Brolin's motion capture performance "supremely effective" and said, "Brolin infuses Thanos with his slit-eyed manipulative glower, so that the evil in this movie never feels less than personal".[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VarietyReview-207) McCarthy wrote, "Brolin's calm, considered reading of the character bestows this conquering beast with an unexpectedly resonant emotional dimension, making him much more than a thick stick figure of a supervillain".[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRReview-206) Gleiberman also praised the film's action sequences, saying "_Infinity War_ brims with tensely spectacular combat sequences, even if the question of who's going to win each one has that extravagantly arbitrary could-[Mighty-Mouse](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mighty_Mouse "Mighty Mouse")-beat-up-[Superman](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Superman "Superman")? quality".[[205]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VarietyReview-207) McCarthy called the scale of the action "astonishing",[[204]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-THRReview-206) and Travers wrote, "_Avengers: Infinity War_ leaves viewers up in the air, feeling exhilarated and cheated at the same time, aching for a closure that never comes".[[206]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RollingStoneReview-208) Josh Spiegel, also of _The Hollywood Reporter_, said the film takes "a cue from the ending of _[The Empire Strikes Back](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_Empire\_Strikes\_Back "The Empire Strikes Back")_ in its super-sized finale; this is the equivalent of [Han Solo](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo") frozen in the [carbonite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Carbonite_(Star_Wars) "Carbonite (Star Wars)"), on steroids".[[208]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EmpireStrikesBack-210)

[A. O. Scott](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/A._O._Scott "A. O. Scott") of _[The New York Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_New\_York\_Times "The New York Times")_ criticized the film's reliance on other films in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, saying, "Considered on its own, as a single, nearly 2-hour-40-minute movie, _Avengers: Infinity War_ makes very little sense", but conceded that it "was never meant to be viewed or judged in isolation".[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NYTReview-211)[Richard Brody](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Brody "Richard Brody") of _[The New Yorker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The\_New\_Yorker "The New Yorker")_ agreed, stating, "The insubstantiality of the film isn't due to the infinite yet flimsy malleability of C.G.I. gimmickry but, instead, to the dispersion of its drama throughout the many cinematic installations set in the Marvel Cinematic Universe".[[210]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NewYorkerReview-212)[Stephanie Zacharek](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stephanie_Zacharek "Stephanie Zacharek") of _[Time](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Time\_(magazine) "Time (magazine)")_ said, "[It] isn't really a beginning, but more of a middle or an end with a new piece of yarn attached. You need to have seen and internalized every one of the previous 18 Marvel Cinematic Universe movies to fully get it".[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-TimeReview-213)[Justin Chang](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Justin_Chang "Justin Chang") of the _[Los Angeles Times](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Los\_Angeles\_Times "Los Angeles Times")_ called it a "brisk, propulsive, occasionally rousing and borderline-gutsy continuation of a saga that finally and sensibly seems to be drawing to a close", but called its ultimate bid for catharsis "unsuccessful" since the Marvel "assembly line [is not stopped] from chugging ahead with its signature polished, mechanized efficiency".[[212]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-LATReview-214) Scott also criticized the action sequences, calling them "tedious and predictable" and "surely the most expensive parts of the movie, but the money seems less like an imaginative tool than a substitute for genuine imagination".[[209]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NYTReview-211) Likewise, Zacharek said, "There's no pacing in _Avengers: Infinity War_. It's all sensation and no pulse. Everything is big, all of the time".[[211]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-TimeReview-213)

### Audience response

Audiences polled by [CinemaScore](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CinemaScore "CinemaScore") gave the film an average grade of "A" on an A+ to F scale,[[156]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd1-158) and those at [PostTrak](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PostTrak "PostTrak") gave the film an 87% overall positive score and a 68% "definite recommend".[[158]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DeadlineWknd2-160) American YouTube personality Tony "Nem" Mitchell watched the film 103 times in theaters, a world record. When Mitchell's streak was gaining media awareness around his 44th viewing, he noted that IMAX reached out to give him 50 free tickets to continue the streak, and the Russo brothers invited him to _Endgame_'s premiere.[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NemViewingPolygon-215)[[214]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NemViewingComicBook-216)[[215]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NemViewingCBR-217) Mitchell said this was the way he "want[ed] to support Marvel and the Russo brothers".[[213]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-NemViewingPolygon-215) Seventeen-year-old Kieran Harvey from [Staffordshire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Staffordshire "Staffordshire") also watched the film in theaters 100 times. Harvey stated that he "didn't plan on seeing it this many times it just sort of happened" adding that _Infinity War_ "just felt so different to anything I've ever seen before, and I just love it so much so have been going as much as I can!"[[216]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-HarveyViewing-218)

The ending of the film sparked various [Internet meme](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Internet_meme "Internet meme") reactions,[[217]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-CBRMemes-219) including one referencing Spider-Man saying he does not feel good as he disintegrates, which was applied to other things.[[218]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-SpideyFadeMeme-220) The website, _DidThanosKill.Me_ was created for fans to see if they would have been spared by Thanos or not.[[219]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-DidThanosKillMeWebsite-221) The ending also spawned the creation of the [Reddit](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Reddit "Reddit") subreddit, /r/thanosdidnothingwrong. A user within the subreddit suggested that half of the approximately 20,000 subscribers at the time be banned from the subreddit, in order to mimic the events of the film. After the community agreed to the measure, the moderators approached Reddit's administrators to see if the mass ban would even be possible. Once the administrators agreed to the random ban of half the subscribers, it was set to occur on July 9, 2018.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PolygonRedditBan-222) Notice of the impending ban made the subreddit's subscribers increase to over 700,000,[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-GizmodoRedditBan-223) including both of the Russos who subscribed.[[222]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-RussosRedditBan-224) Ahead of the ban, Brolin posted a video saying "Here we go, Reddit users," and ending it with a snap.[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinRedditBan-225) Over 60,000 people watched a live [Twitch](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Twitch_(service) "Twitch (service)") stream of the ban occurring, which lasted several hours.[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-GizmodoRedditBan-223) The ban of over 300,000 accounts, which included Anthony Russo, was the largest in Reddit's history.[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-GizmodoRedditBan-223)[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VergeRedditBan-226) Those banned then gathered in the new subreddit, /r/inthesoulstone.[[220]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-PolygonRedditBan-222)[[221]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-GizmodoRedditBan-223) One Reddit user who participated described the ban as embodying "the spirit of the Internet" with people "banding together, en masse, around something relatively meaningless but somehow decidedly awesome and hilarious".[[224]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-VergeRedditBan-226) Andrew Tigani of _[Screen Rant](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Screen\_Rant "Screen Rant")_ said this showed "how impactful the film has already become to pop culture. It is also a testament to how valuable fan interaction can be via social media".[[223]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-BrolinRedditBan-225)

### Accolades

At the [91st Academy Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/91st_Academy_Awards "91st Academy Awards"), _Avengers: Infinity War_ received a nomination for [Best Visual Effects](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Academy_Award_for_Best_Visual_Effects "Academy Award for Best Visual Effects").[[225]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-AcademyAwards-227) The film's other nominations include an [Annie Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annie_Award "Annie Award"),[[226]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Annie-228) a [British Academy Film Award](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/British_Academy_Film_Award "British Academy Film Award"),[[227]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Bafta-229) and two [Critics' Choice Awards](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Critics%27_Choice_Awards "Critics' Choice Awards"),[[228]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-CriticsChoice-230) among others. In 2020, _Infinity War_ was ranked seventh in an _[Empire](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Empire\_(magazine) "Empire (magazine)")_ magazine poll for the 100 greatest films of the 21st century.[[229]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EmpireRanking-231)

Sequel
------

_Avengers: Endgame_ was released on April 26, 2019,[[230]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-EndgameTitleReveal-232) with the Russos returning to direct,[[91]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-Russos-93) and Markus and McFeely once again writing the screenplay.[[92]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avengers:_Infinity_War#cite_note-MarkusMcFeely-94)

Please don't skip this 1-minute read. It's Thursday, August 14, and we're running a short fundraiser to support Wikipedia. If you've lost count of how many times you've visited Wikipedia this year, we hope that means it's given you at least $2.75 of knowledge. 25 years ago Wikipedia was a dream. A wildly ambitious, probably impossible dream. A dream that came together piece by piece. Now, 65 million articles. 260,000 volunteers across the entire world. Here's to 25 years of knowledge, humanity, and collaboration at its best.
